website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, environmentally friendly chainsaw that runs quietly and is simple for beginners to operate.
pros: Wraparound handle gives you several options for how to hold the chainsaw
Starts with the push of a button
cons: This chainsaw takes more time and effort to cut through thicker branches

customer_reviews.title: Purchased without battery. I used the battery from my ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased without battery . I used the battery from my greenworks weedeater. 40v 2a. Cost was around 50 bucks with prime 2 day shipping. Never owned a chainsaw of any kind. I was able to cut up the tree that feel over my fence line and remove a tree out of my grape vines and chop up the trunk before charge ran out. Figured this review will let you know what this chainsaw can handle and how long the charge will last. See attached pictures. All was done on one charge.
customer_reviews.author: eric bethard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Had never run a chain saw before......80 year old widow.....but was able to trim and cut into chunks, a 15 inch diameter oak tree that had fallen across the fence between my yard and the neighbor's bull pasture. No problems. Probably took a little longer than it would have taken one of you "hairy-legged" type people, but that's ok. No oil (other than for the chain), no gas, and no yanking on a rope until my arm wanted to fall off. This is my third GreenWorks purchase...also have their lawn mower and weed-whacker, and am very happy with all three. Good quality stuff. A little pricey, but worth it for no problems. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: E. Traweek

customer_reviews.title: It is slow.
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to the great reviews from people who had never used a chainsaw before. I really wanted this to be the answer to my needs, but the technology still has a ways to go. The thing is light, comfortable and easy to use. The problem is it's s-l-o-w. It really tears up wood and leaves a jagged cut. I made 2 cuts and put it back in the box to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Welte

customer_reviews.title: Blew up on first use..
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw worked for 1 log. During the second log mid cut I heard a "pop" from the motor and saw a little puff of smoke. Now it just humms instead of spinning. Greenworks support won't answer the phone or return my emails for support. Terrible product and bad service.
customer_reviews.author: ZipLipZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and great for large yards with lots of trees
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan of Greenworks and own several of their gadgets. This chain saw is lighter than my smaller 10” electric (plug in) saw and it handles better. I would say almost too light so careful when cutting. I cleaned up and sawed the front yard in about two hours and the battery life held up. We have mountain mahogany which is very hard, honey locust, pine and spruce. The saw worked like a champ and I’m happy to not have to carry around a plug. Trees and limbs can be sawed where they lay making work a lot easier. I’m 5’1” and near 60 yrs and. Can handle the saw fine.
customer_reviews.author: Maria H AD

customer_reviews.title: Just look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the pole saw at the same time. The pole saw is great. This chainsaw is NOT. the pole saw spins at about twice the speed meaning it cuts through things quickly. This chainsaw is nice and lightweight but it doesn't really cut through anything the pole saw doesn't. Look elsewhere for your chainsaw needs. I'm returning mine on monday.
customer_reviews.author: farkedup

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, small, perfect for boards
customer_reviews.text: With yard work and yard sales, this chainsaw allows for a spectrum of abilities to choose from. My buddy Bill uses this chainsaw to help cut some planks for a table and had little to no resistance with the blades. Disclaimer: chainsaws are not toys, even if you enjoy practicing good work methods.
customer_reviews.author: si.yrxkrru1t3177Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Fully satisfied by the performance and durability for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The value of this chainsaw is unbeatable. I'm a fan of the brand and the idea of interchangeable batteries. So I've already had a mower when I bought this chainsaw without batteries. And it worked well for 2 years, perfectly meeting my small household/backyard projects. I only changed oil regularly and replaced the chain (Oregon brand) once. Then it broke entirely - the motor started smelling and stopped performing at all. Thanks to the 4-year warranty, I just received a brand new chainsaw from the manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: Happy dad, NC

customer_reviews.title: Broke in first use
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use my new chainsaw to cut up some old limbs that have been laying on my property. I followed all directions and it worked well on the first 3 limbs. While cutting the 4th limb I heard a crack, a washer fell out and the entire chain assembly came apart. The limbs were all under 3" in diameter. Very disappointed in the product and returned to Amazon. Thanks Amazon for the prompt refund.
customer_reviews.author: Riggo_MD

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic and poorly made..
customer_reviews.text: This is a very poorly built piece of equipment. The handle broke the second time I used it. A very poor design for the handle to be secured.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: No. Need
customer_reviews.text: Very weak. Don’t expect typical results that you get from a gas powered saw. But, I expected it to do a better job than my hedge trimmer...
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Cutting power lacking.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, but sad to say, I found it flawed. The oil filler cap is at an awkward angle, so spillage was rampant. But it was the lack of cutting ability that turned this around and back to Amazon (usual wonderful customer service). It just had no juice, no penetrating power. A branch 2" thick presented a challenge. 1/2=1" thick chattered and flew around before a cut started. It's pretty, well balanced, the battery charges pretty quickly, but it's what's up front that counts and this just didn't have it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbo

customer_reviews.title: Great for ladies or people with bad wrists too
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. My didn’t come with the charger or battery and it took forever to get that corrected. However, I doubt that is the normal. I live in arizona and have mesquite trees everywhere. I’ve pretty much chopped down all my branches that were dead or in a weird spot on the trees. This thing really cuts well. It’s also light enough weight to toss around. Ladies for sure this is useful for us. I’m strong and could handle a bigger one but this does the job just fine. I’ve even used it to cut lumber when my battery was dead on my circular saw. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: More than a toy, but just barely
customer_reviews.text: I have a Greenworks rechargeable pole saw that I like a lot, and I've always wished the pole were detachable so I could use it as a regular saw. So when I found this one pretty cheap (didn't include battery), I figured I'd pick one up and use the pole saw battery with it. It works OK, but it tends to grab and jerk more than a gas-powered saw does. I'm pretty sure it's because these little guys just can't spin the chain anywhere near as fast as the gas-burners do. Still, it's very handy when I need more than a lopper but don't want to start up my big saw.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Works great, leave the gas can in the garage
customer_reviews.text: Another decent product from GreenWorks. This is my 4th lawn appliance from GreenWorks, utilizing the 40 Volt battery. All have been good replacements for my gas-powered counterparts. The 20292 chain saw works fine for most light duty consumer use, has good torque, and can easily cut any logs up to about 7-8" in diameter. It could probably cut more, but I wouldn't risk it for this machinery. A little heavy with the big battery and the balance is funny, but overall another good piece of equipment from GreenWorks. And the best part - NO GASOLINE!
customer_reviews.author: J. Soriano

customer_reviews.title: So far great I’m 63 and just cut 20 trees 5 to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far great I’m 63 and just cut 20 trees 5 to 12 inches in diameter. Just like limb trimmer I bought best money I’ve spent. I do have 2 batteries so I flip flop. Thanks green works!
customer_reviews.author: Burger king

customer_reviews.title: Absolute little animal.
customer_reviews.text: This little dude tears through tree limbs as quickly as any gas powered chainsaw that I have ever used. To say I'm surprised is an under-statement. I was going to rent a chainsaw, and decided to try this battery operated unit (I already own other Greenworks products, so I didn't have to buy a battery). Boy am I happy. It literally just paid for itself. I only used 1/2 of one of the small batteries to cut off two limbs 8 inches in diameter, and then cut into pieces. Unless you get a lemon (as some others have), you can't beat this bargain of a deal!
customer_reviews.author: SubySubyDo

customer_reviews.title: Good - Until it died
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of small trees to remove, so I purchased this saw. It worked well on the first tree but the saw stopped working after I dropped the second tree. It was not a battery issue - I tried several different batteries - charged all night and tried again the next day - still nothing. Fortunately, It was still eligible for return and was sent back. I had to buy another saw to finish up cutting the tree into pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Batt2fd

customer_reviews.title: Possibly to reduce a headache please read.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I give the chainsaw 4 stars. However the manufacturers put the chain on backwards and one part that helps hold the chain on a retaining clip came off. I couldn’t find it of course so I had to buy a kit to find the right size. After dealing with all that the chainsaw works great. So be sure to check the direction of the chain before use as I should have done.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Careful
customer_reviews.text: Green works cannot put the correct item numbers together so when u buy an item that works great, you want to buy other items that use the same battery pack and when u receive them it isn't correct, you send it back and get charged a fee?
customer_reviews.author: Boca

customer_reviews.title: I love this chainsaw to replace my black&decker one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because my black&decker 10" chainsaw frequently stop working and chain slide out of the blade. so I bought this one to cut a 1.5 feet diameter tree, it works perfectly and only take few minutes. I also cut some other small trees, chain never out of the blade. so I love this one. Please do not buy black&decker, it sucks, the chain are always out of the blade so I have to put it back again and again, the design has big problem.
customer_reviews.author: jz5188

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: As an older woman with zero chainsaw experience, this little saw has been a perfect tool to learn with. I had to laugh when I started it up, because it sounds more like a blender, but it's proved its worth by taking down quite a few trees already. The largest diameter I've cut so far has been about five to six inches. Obviously, the larger the tree, the longer it's going to take to cut, but it'll do the job. I haven't had any oil leak issues and the chain stays pretty tight, even after cutting a dozen small trees. The light weight makes it perfect for me to handle. Definitely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GraniteStater

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Amazon purchase of all time
customer_reviews.text: I am 67, 5'2", 110 lbs (female) and was very worried that I would be able to handle a chainsaw. I am so pleased with my purchase. It is very easy to use and works very well. I wear out before the battery does. The directions were a little daunting so I watched a couple of Youtube demos and was set to go. I have been clearing my back yard. So far the largest tree was about 21/2 inch diameter and it worked great! Would absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila H. Morone

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw for a beginner. The 12 inch blade has kept me from removing trees wider than 10 inch diameter. An experienced person can easily take out large trees with the saw. It handles beautifully with soft wood, (pine). Hard wood takes longer to cut through as it is a smaller chainsaw. It hold its charge for a good 6 hours to 8 hours on soft wood. Charges quickly and is easy to handle. All chainsaws have kickback, for beginner like myself one needs to read the instructions and align your body up correctly with the tree and the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it's light weight, easy to carry and maneuver, and has good battery life. BUT, chain speed is sadly lacking. The saw doesn't "cut", it chews through wood. Forget nice clean cuts. Jagged edges in dire need of cleaning up is the typical result. The much higher chain speeds of gas-powered units make for far cleaner work. Disappointing and not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: byron j

customer_reviews.title: Pruning Tool Only
customer_reviews.text: I was really wanting to like this and had high hopes. But this is really just a toy chain saw. It might be alright for the occasional light pruning job on limbs less than 5 inches. But if you're after something to replace your gas saw for firewood, then think again. It just does not generate the chain speed necessary to be efficient. If you keep your expectations low, then you might be alright, or if you have never used a gas saw before. But for those currently using a gas saw, I can guarantee you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MBK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is lightweight and easy to use. The battery is still working on the original charge after doing a fair amount of cutting. I especially like the ease of adding oil, and being able to see how much is left. Unlike my last chainsaw, this one doesn't seem to leak oil. The chain came loose after one particular cut, and it was super easy to put back on (look for a video to show you how). You'll want to order oil at the same time because oil doesn't come with the chainsaw. I have multiple Greenworks garden power tools and love them all so was confident in this purchase. Did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: amk

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money - Parts fall off and it leaks
customer_reviews.text: Retaining clip holding chain keeps falling off. Finally lost it. Leaks chain oil also. Contacted factory, gave them the exact part number. They sent me a gear :( Asked about the leaking chain oil that no other electric saw seems to suffer and factory representative stated that they recommend emptying the container after every use. No plans for fix at factory. This retaining clip and oil leak are showing up in other reviews. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Top notch electric chain saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great example of form and function being optimized. Absolutely reliable, starts every single time, none of the clumsiness of a corded chain saw, very easy to maneuver into position - and cuts very well. Understand that you won't be felling any 16" trees with this baby, but for quick and easy work on a smaller scale, this is great. And in terms of value, it's exceptional. I haven't experienced oil leaking. Changing the battery is a snap. I can't find anything negative to say about it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doc K.

customer_reviews.title: Unit arrived without battery or charger!  Contacted support by email got nothing back!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for spring/summer cleanup. It arrived but without charger and battery. Unit description says it comes with both. I sent a email to them I have not heard anything back. Right now I have a giant paper weight :( Revised my review: Tyra @ Greenworks got this fixed for me thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use - being petite and loves to do yard work this cordless chainsaw really helps me a lot, not just saving money but I can cut down any small branches with out asking for other people to do it for me. Hope this last longer- this is my second greenworks cordless chainsaw. Easy to use and convenient without the annoyance of gas or electrical cord.
customer_reviews.author: suziedu

customer_reviews.title: Super chain saw
customer_reviews.text: I have spinal issues so I was searching a battery power saw to cut all my woods down-I use a DR and my Worx but still need a light chain saw and this is perfect! I even got a 16” chain and bar and works great I am finally cutting it all down and when my back starts to yell the battery is usually down to 1 light and so my surprise I stop and put battery on charge and in few minutes it’s fully charged again- now if the southern rains would stay away I could get the job done but even with wet wood it cuts like a super saw💁
customer_reviews.author: Debbie L. Hadden

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, just buy it! Work well, battery lasts long (get a 4hr battery), and it cuts fast. I don't like gas tools because you smell like a gas after using so this saw is a blessing for not requiring gas. Its lightweight powerful. I wouldn't recommend cutting huge trees with it, but I've cut 1 foot diameter trees that fell down on my property and it worked like a charm. Cut down 40 feet of a tree in no time, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mamone

customer_reviews.title: About what you would expect
customer_reviews.text: It works. Doesn't have much power but being battery, it is handy. The main detriment is that the teeth are too far apart. It is very jarring to use. You could probably develop carpel tunnel pretty quickly if you used it much.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas A. Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: (Rate Features) pretty much says it all. 5 stars all around. Love the fact that the batteries from the hedge trimmer and weed eater fit the chain saw. Greenworks makes great stuff. I wrote the above review a few months back when I first purchased this saw and had only used it a few times. I just spent 3 days ( about 5 hours a day ) cutting down and cutting up a 40-foot tree. The battery never ran down. I put the battery on the charger overnight and it ran all day long. I ran out of juice before the battery. I wish GreenWorks made a saw like Worx's JawSaw. I would buy today.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great "Light Duty" saw
customer_reviews.text: Great "Light Duty" saw. Will use for branches and smaller stuff. Plan to keep it in the back of my truck, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Runs great! Although had to tighten down the chain just ...
customer_reviews.text: Going on week three no errors yet. Runs great! Although had to tighten down the chain just so the saw would not slip off track. The chain tenson had to be super tightened. Small projects works amazingly. I suggest if your looking into buying this good luck. Came new in a store bought box. Love this machine. May or might not come with battery and charger. Please read the fine print before ordering. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: daryl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After a hard New England winter when lots of trees and large branches came down I decided to do the branch cuttings myself and save money by not hiring professionals. This chainsaw is not too large and, as a woman, found it very easy to use. With a lot of awareness while using this chainsaw I came away with all my limbs attached and unhurt. I especially love that it does not run on gas but is battery powered. The battery charge lasted way past my energy. Judging by past winters, I am sure more trees and branches will come down in the future and feel I made a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Regine Duncker

customer_reviews.title: This little chainsaw can handle tough jobs.
customer_reviews.text: We have 4.5 acres of woods with a long steep driveway. We had some storms and several big oak trees fell including one across the driveway. My Stihl chainsaw would not start so I had to use the Greensworks. It cut through these big branches as well as my regular chainsaw and the battery did not give out. It was actually easier, much lighter, low noise and no exhaust fumes. Some of the branches were medium to large size, of course it would not be able to handle a full trunk or very large branches.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Even an elder can use this easily!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little saw! Easy to use and lightweight enough to hold easily. Regular gas chainsaws had become a thing of the past for me due to the weight and pulling the starter cord. As a woman of 75 I have lost a bit of muscle and added a bit of pain. With this little saw I can still cut branches and saplings easily. The battery lasts longer than I expected and while charging I get a perfect break.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Durfee

customer_reviews.title: Darn good
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm satisfied with his chainsaw. It does do a good job and it is able to cut wood as expected. If you're using this to cut Hardwoods or large branches the battery will last a very short time. If you're using it to cut small branches that have recently died, it'll last a while. It is very light and maneuverable it doesn't kick much if you've already bought into this line and have a couple batteries it would be an ideal option. If you're willing to break up a project over a couple of different episodes to let the battery charge in between, this will work great for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I just used this chainsaw for a small maple weed that was growing up into some power-lines in the back yard. The maple was about 15 feet tall, somewhat thick, and this 40 V 12 inch saw took it out no problem. The chain does have a habit of getting caught up in some stickier branches, but could be due to my inexperience with a chainsaw. So far I'm impressed for the low-cost. Don't expect this to do heavy jobs, but medium to light jobs are perfect for this. Great for a beginner like me!
customer_reviews.author: Dan_Man

customer_reviews.title: I Like This!
customer_reviews.text: I already have several Greenworks tools so I already have the batteries and their quality is decent. This is no exception, and it works very very well. It cuts well. Its pretty safe to use (following safety guidelines of course) It's lightweight. It's easy to hold. The oil-well for the chain is a bit small but its workable. No complaints at all, very pleased with chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: easy start
customer_reviews.text: Used the chain saw to clear brush around the end of the driveway. It would have been a near impossible job with my hand clippers. I'm 75years old. Finally a chain saw that is easy to start, light weight so it doesn't stress my hand and arm and yet it does the job. The 12 inch was perfect for the brush size and I would recommend buying that length for medium clearing jobs. I don't know about battery life because I run out of steam for the session before it does.
customer_reviews.author: happywoman

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love my little green chainsaw! I have been needing something to remove small trees and branches and this little charmer works great. I am 62 years old and have a degenerative spinal condition, so a big heavy gas saw was completely out of the question. This little guy weighs next to nothing and is so easy to use that I have just been having a wonderful time cleaning things up around here. And compared to the noise of a gas saw, it's remarkably quiet as well.
customer_reviews.author: WoodsRose

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is great for little jobs. Easy to use. So far it's been dependable. However, due to the slowness of the chain revolution, it's a bit difficult to get a clean cut started. It will take longer than a faster saw if you have a lot of stuff to cut. But it's fine for what I bought it to do, little jobs without the hassle of gas power. I'll probably buy a GW string trimmer that uses the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Short charge life
customer_reviews.text: The saw is slow, almost like you're grinding thru the wood instead of cutting it. It's got a lot of vibration from cutting that transfers to the hands. Only got eight cuts on a small log before it quit and needed a recharge. I don't recommend it for more than small jobs or trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Ringofan

customer_reviews.title: More power than expected but,
customer_reviews.text: Quite powerful and plenty long lasting with smallest 40 volt battery. However, the chain has very wide cutting tooth spacing, such that the saw jumps up off the wood while cutting. This is most noticeable when cutting small branches where maybe only 1 or 2 teeth would be in contact with the branch. By spacing the teeth out, there is less resistance to cutting allowing you to cut through larger branches, albeit more slowly than with my plug in electric chain saw. Not having the cord is probably worth it as I have an extension cord with a repair because of the corded chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Good for light duty
customer_reviews.text: Keeping in mind the price and fact that it's battery operated, it's not a bad light duty chainsaw. I fell a small 8" diameter tree and pruned some branches here and there (none larger than 5" diameter). It also did better than our sawzall when cutting OSB and 2x4s for demolishing a shed. Keep in mind it is super light and doesn't have the safety brake most gas powered ones have, so you need to be weary of kickback.
customer_reviews.author: Photostefanie

customer_reviews.title: Small Trees Wonder
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to cut branches off trees this is an excellent choice. The small size of the saw limits you to branches that are under 18" or so but this is typically larger than almost any tree branches. I used this the other day to trim back some of our oak and hickory trees and it worked fine for that purpose. I use the same battery model for three different tools now, and they all seem to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ken the Teacher

customer_reviews.title: You Get The Gas From Your Wall ! .....
customer_reviews.text: What a sweet little machine... I highly recommend it for small to medium cutting of yard trees.... It is light weight and very easy to handle. The battery pops in and out like a dream. This saw is ready to use right out of the box... And the battery does not run out quickly... I have mine all charged up and neatly hanging on the wall in my tool room... I highly recommend this small chain saw for mild to moderate tree cutting... And don't forget, you get the gas for it out of your wall.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Wodburn

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say about this saw. I've been using it instead of my 14 inch gas saw for almost everything. I have a farm and much acreage with trees lining both sides. I mostly use this saw to dismember the fallen trees so I can either dispose of them or use them for firewood. Some fallen trees are very old and are cherry, or apple or oak. If the trunk is really big, I'll use the gas saw, but mostly I use the Greenworks.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Remove bar oil when storing, it will leak. It's in the manual...
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it has an anti-kickback chain, which doesn't allow it to cut as well. It's an easy fix, just buy another chain. The manual was very specific that the machine will leak oil, so its necessary to drain the bar oil out after each use. Bar oil is expensive, so that was a nice revelation. Totally explains why my electric saws leak all over. Who knew? I am very pleased with this purchase, and will be designing a holster so I can open carry it when I fight off the covidiots who violate my 6 feet of social distancing space. Will reorder again, this machine is cool!
customer_reviews.author: Primary Headmistress at School of Hard Knocks

customer_reviews.title: Don’t lose the chain wheel sprocket
customer_reviews.text: If you lose the chain wheel sprocket, you’re screwed. Getting a replacement is a nightmare, 2 parts mailed to me for replacement are not the right size. So frustrating. When it works, it works fine. When it doesn’t, the chain saw is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Little work horse
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chainsaw, the battery outlasted me, I have 2 so the I always have one ready. Cuts great, you just have to be mindful that when cutting you don't want to use the tip like you might with a gas saw because it jumps around, having said that it cuts like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Go-hunter

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I feel that this chainsaw is powerful for its compact, easily handled size. The battery lasts a long time. I use it to cut downed branches at my friends farm to use for firewood. I looked up uTube videos on how to use a chainsaw correctly and safely and was good to go. I am a 72 year old female, less than 5 feet tall. My little Greenworks chainsaw can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NICE WORKING CHAINSAW
customer_reviews.text: I AM A 63 YEAR OLD WOMAN WHO HAS NEVER USED A CHAINSAW BEFORE! I RECIEVED MY 12 INCH GREENWORKS BATTERY RAN SAW 2 DAYS AGO AND HAVE GOTTEN INTO IT. I AM NOW SAWING UP ALL THE YEARS OF FALLEN TREES AND CLEARING OUT BRUSH. THIS SAW IS GREAT! SO FAR I TIRE LONG BEFORE BATTERY DIES AND I HAVE WORKED AN HOUR. THE WEIGHT IS DOABLE FOR ME. ALL IN ALL I AM SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS.
customer_reviews.author: walkingmydestiny

customer_reviews.title: Decent tool so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Probably now my favorite tool. I live in NC with soft pines. My gas chainsaw always seemed to struggle with the sap and just stopping. Spent more time starting it than cutting. Made 30-40 cuts with this and blew through some of the small trees I had down. It’s a rough cut but i’m Not looking for awards. I doubt you could clear a forest with this but it will delimb, chew through dead trees, and drop small to meet trees. You can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Battery outlasts me. I now have two of these for two locations. Not the power of the gas saw but best for all the small jobs i have. The ease of use and its light weight far outweigh any disadvantage of power. Does not replace having a gas saw for the big jobs. I have now purchased a hedge trimmer which uses the same battery. I will also purchase a string trimmer which will also use the same battery. One battery with three tools. Its a great system.
customer_reviews.author: Poco

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks works
customer_reviews.text: Well I have to say it was better than I expected. This is the first time using it since the purchase, and the battery lasted a lot longer then I thought it would. I didn't record the time, but the picture shows how much I was able to cut on one charge. A lot less noise then it's gas counterparts, but I still used hearing protection. It's cuts better having the wood up against the guard, so it would be better with the spikes like on gas models. So I also have to say that this is perfect for an occasional small tree or bush from time to time, but not for someone cutting a lot of full grown trees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for light work cutting. Will cut limbs 4 to 5 inch diameter easily and bigger ones with a little patience and persistence. No lugging gas cans around and battery will last about 30-45 minutes. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not include required oil
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it yet because it says to use only Greenworks oil and they don't provide it. On top of that you can't buy it anywhere including Amazon where we bought the chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Aussiemama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I love this little machine! I am a 55 year old woman and I wanted to be able to help out in the woods when my husband was out working, and I don’t mean stacking sticks or bringing the drinks! This is a dream! I can start it quickly and cut through anything. The only problem is keeping it out of my husband’s hands! It is lightweight and I feel safe while using it!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Tomayko

customer_reviews.title: Won’t Buy Greenworks Ever Again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw for light duty work - softwood branches less than 3” in diameter - on our property. Unfortunately after less than 5 hours of use the chain stops while the saw makes a sound indicating something in the motor is malfunctioning. My guess is that it is a cheap gear internal to the saw. This is the second Greenworks saw I’ve purchased that has problems with the motor. The first was a pole saw, which had a fixed mount motor brush come unmounted. Bottom line, I would not recommend Greenworks products based upon these two experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: another 3 pound toxic batter for the landfill.
customer_reviews.text: These guys suck in that the batteries are not interchangeable with other 40v brands. I returned.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is just fine for small jobs around the yard. I have been using it a few times and it never ran out of battery. It was strong enough for any limb. Be sure to loosen the chain guard nut before adjusting the chain tension, then tighten it again. This should prevent the chain from coming off. If it does come off, when replacing be sure to loosen the tension and put the tensioning lug into the corresponding hole on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Put oil in the tank and battery in the holder and sliced through 10” limbs of oak with no problem. Did 5 large limbs and 5-6 smaller 2-4” branches and still had 3 lites on my 4Ah battery. This will be a life saver when working on my remote trail. Uses the same batteries as my mower and other yard tools. Should have gotten it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little saw. We have the 12" bar and generally use it to cut 4" to 10" diameter hardwood logs for firewood. It saws through them about 3/4 as fast as a gas saw - were talking only a few seconds difference. Battery life is about 35 - 50 cuts. Well worth the money for general home use, would definitely recommend it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harris

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE PERFORMANCE FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive battery operated cordless chainsaw exceeded expectations and is a real performer. Battery life was outstanding. I used this to cut up pine tree limbs that fell down in an ice storm. I have a $629 Stihl professional grade chainsaw that I did not want to use because it is somewhat heavy. I bought the cordless tiny lightweight chainsaw to make the job easier for me. This little chainsaw was an incredible performer.
customer_reviews.author: R. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: but it keeps going through limbs and stumps like butter, and I haven't run out of battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I've done quite a bit of chopping. I know the chain is new, but it keeps going through limbs and stumps like butter, and I haven't run out of battery power on any project. I replaced the blade and chain on my old corded chainsaw. I know the newness won't last forever, but I love the convenience of the battery and I use it a lot more because of that. So far, I am very happy. I love the absence of the cord and I don't miss the hassle of a gas chainsaw (even though I thought they had a bit more power).
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and up for the job!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this chainsaw since Sep2019 and it is very impressive. The battery life is great and it requires very little maintenance. This works great for small jobs and it is very lightweight and well balanced. I highly recommend anyone to consider this chainsaw, if they are not looking to cut down an entire forest.:)
customer_reviews.author: K.F.

customer_reviews.title: A very convenient chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I got this chainsaw and the leaf blower at the same time they both are extremely efficient I like how convenient it is to have it ready to go grab it when needed. Just as a note for those thinking of purchasing this you need to watch the oil very close it is a self oiling chain which means when it sits it will leak so don't let it sit on anything You Don't Want Staind. Check the oil every time you use it. It will make the chain bar last longer. Thank you for your support
customer_reviews.author: BURT

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas to clear trails on our wooded property. He wanted something lightweight that he could carry easily. This fit the bill perfectly. He loves it (and he's pretty picky!) He is impressed with how long it will cut between battery chargings and the power of such a small saw.
customer_reviews.author: Staci H.

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful but OK for the job
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw did not have the power I have come to expect from a battery operated saw. I have a Kobalt on a lesser powered battery that has more cutting power. This Green works cuts and feels safe using a small 12 inch blade, but you must be patient and not tempted to force it down. Overal, it's fairly good. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Jat

customer_reviews.title: Battery/Charger Failed After Minimal Use
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw itself worked reasonably well. From the beginning the battery life would only last <30min. For the first few charges the charger would indicate the battery was fully charged even though it was not. After about 30-60min of sitting on the charger the indicator would switch to charging and charge the battery, but the life of the battery was still limited. After about 3-4 charges the battery would no longer charge. I have contacted Greenworks, but so far they have not responded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easiest chainsaw I ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have owned gas chainsaws in the past and they have always been challenging to use - hard to start and keep running, chain tension issues, etc. The Greenworks battery chainsaw is totally different - starts up first time every time and just does the job. Lightweight, inexpensive, great battery life - what’s not to like. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Strong, affordable, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Battery is entirely based on which one you use. I use their longest lasting batteries and they still only last so long on the chain saw. The chain also comes off easily which is nice for replacement but annoying if im cutting. However, it does cut and can push threw tree limbs at least two inches thick (largest ive cut) so it works; and if you are getting all battery powered tools i recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi Melnick

customer_reviews.title: nice little machine
customer_reviews.text: I was fairly satisfied with the Greenworks 12 inch 40 volt cordless chainsaw. For the price, and ease of use, along with the cordless feature and lightweight size, I was able to saw some decent sized logs into smaller pieces (10-12 inches diameter). The battery died after about an hour, but charged up quickly. I think I'll get the best use of this chainsaw when I have to trim limbs in the orchard, and saw up smaller branches.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy R

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: Cut up limbs of old dead apricot tree into firewood (some limbs were 8" diameter). Whole job used only half the battery capacity. Chain held its tension (used a regular chain instead of supplied skip-link chain). Oil reservoir still half full. Extremely pleased with effectiveness and ease of use! Now I'll only need my 16" gas powered saw for the really big stuff like the main trunk and remaining stump of the tree.
customer_reviews.author: georgie girl

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Strong and nice chainsaw. It takes about 1hr to fully charge and easy to use. I choose this one as it is powerful and lightweight (8.2 lbs included battery) for me. I can easily bring it up to tree to cut down the small branches. However, it doesn’t come with chain oil. As a chainsaw beginner, you may have to prepare chain oil before using it.
customer_reviews.author: S-Rex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Strong Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how strong, durable and sharply this chainsaw performed. I'm very satisfied with my purchase. With the two batteries, it was enough to turn a time consuming job and get it done in minutes. I've had this for over a year now and now issues. I keep my Chainsaw outside in the shed, but I keep both batteries inside the house where it's nice and cool. Hopefully that will make the batteries last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect from an electric chainsaw, and if you own a ranch, this probably isn't for you. However, for a large or wooded suburban lot where you might sometimes have to clear some brush or chop up fallen branches, it's great. Seems to be powerful enough and the battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadgets,powerful battery
customer_reviews.text: Like the lightweight and durability however it jumps n leaves a raw edge due to the chain I think is a little too large teeth Cuts well especially 1-2in limbs holding the wood to cut, close to the body of the chainsaw Like that I can interchange my weed eater battery with the chainsaw,both being GreenWorks
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: No human blood, but the trees are screaming
customer_reviews.text: Chopped down 5 or 6 trees in my back yard, having never used a chainsaw before in my life. Didn’t cut off any of my human bits. That’s a win.
customer_reviews.author: C Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for branch trimming
customer_reviews.text: Very simple operation. I cut a dozen 3 foot sections of 4" tree branches while pruning a pine tree. Each cut required setting the branch at the intersection of the chain and motor case. Just hold it there while the saw did the work. Battery drain was nil for this set of cuts
customer_reviews.author: Orbit

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: it is very weak and not a lot of power, it spins to low and hardly cut true wood,it is nice to cut some leaves of the trees, that it, damn me for buying this. Back to gas power then
customer_reviews.author: richard k.

customer_reviews.title: Holy Smokes!
customer_reviews.text: This sucker cuts! I am putting serious lumber on the ground. I can blow through 6-8 inch trees/saplings with no effort. Put it away for a few weeks, bring it back out and BAM! No bad gasoline, no pulling the start cord 50 times, just pull the trigger and start making sawdust. TIMBER!
customer_reviews.author: James R Bates

customer_reviews.title: A little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a chainsaw before, but this little workhorse was easy to use and did a great job. The battery lasted a full hour while I took down two renegade bushes with trunks that were 6-8 inches in diameter. I trimmed off the branches and sectioned the trunks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy J Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, feels like a quality product
customer_reviews.text: It's well designed and feels solid, rather than cheap. Importantly it cuts as expected, that is slightly slower than a gas chainsaw. But, it's also significantly lighter and does not vibrate as much. I used it to cut-up a large fallen leader, made about 30-40 cuts on 7-10" diameter maple, no issues at all. The battery was still going strong too. I can't comment on long-term, but again it seems like a well thought-out product and I expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Feinberg

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: The Greenworks 12-in cordless chainsaw works absolutely great - almost right out of the box. Just charge the battery, put in chair-bar oil and start-it up. Extremely quick start and worked absolutely great to cut up a large tree that recently fell in our patio - some branches more than 8 inches thick. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Wife who does the yard work
customer_reviews.text: This is light weight and easy to handle. I have cut many branches off with ease and my husband has used it for a few farm projects. The chainsaw battery life seems adequate to do every task around the yard. Best of all I never need to use my husbands hand pull to start chainsaw ever again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Momwith2boys

customer_reviews.title: Really cuts well
customer_reviews.text: If you already have a greenworks battery from another tool, this is a great value. It cuts as well as a much more expensive battery operated Stihl or Husky. The 40 amp battery gives over an hour of cutting. I have 2 batteries so it works for me. as for all Greenworks tools, it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Got this right before we had a massive storm that downed or damaged 85% of the trees in my area. This was so useful for cleaning the debris that was on my fences and in my yard. It is so easy to use, the battery lasts a really long time and it’s a comfortable weight.
customer_reviews.author: dotsheldon

customer_reviews.title: Light, good price, not too loud
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this chainsaw about an hour a day (till the battery dies) for the last week to cut firewood and drop some small trees. I’m very happy with it. The price is great. Compared to gas chainsaws that I’ve used, this electric one is quieter, has less vibration, and no exhaust. Working with it is pleasant and enjoyable. It’s pretty lightweight too. Now let’s just hope it withstands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It worked great the first couple of times I used it. Then it Quit. I had used it about 4 hours. Sent it back, don’t need something that won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: rab

customer_reviews.title: Best little chain saw ever!
customer_reviews.text: For small to medium sized trees, this is great. I have cut up two 40 ft branches up to one foot radius with no problem on one charge each. No gas, oil or cords and very little noise. No pulling cords to start and easy to adjust chain tightness. Perfect for the occasional small tree or huge fallen limb!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca or Michael Parmley

customer_reviews.title: NICE LIGHTWEIGHT SAW.....BAD BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: AFTER USING THE CHAINSAW FOR THE THIRD TIME, I CHARGED THE BATTERY OVER NIGHT. IN THE MORNING, WITH THE SMELL OF BURNT PLASTIC, I NOTICED THE PACK PARTLY MELTED. IT WAS NOT REMOVABLE FROM THE CHARGER. I GUESS I WILL HAVE TO BUY ANOTHER BATTERY AND CHARGER. OTHERWISE THE CHAINSAW WORKED WELL.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Storti

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great for yard work in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I already owned several Greenworks 40v products so didn't need to buy battery or charger. Wanted something portable to use on older shrubs with branches too thick for my loper or hedge trimmer and this does the job. Trimmed two large shrubs on a single battery without recharging (had one light left on charge meter). Downside is the "kick" when sawing thicker branches but practice will teach me how to properly compensate. Might work best if you first trim smaller branches for better visibility, then use loper to finish up any remaining stragglers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw. Battery life seems to last a strong 45 minutes of cutting. It’s incredibly light, especially compared to any gas-powered chainsaw. You can even use it with one hand if you have to reach, but this is NOT recommended. It’s safe, easy to use, and fairly efficient. No startup process or idling whatsoever. Just add chain oil and snap in the battery, and it’ll run for as long as you hold down the trigger
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: Made a few cuts with it not enough power had to send back, I have the trimmer and blower works good but need bigger battery maybe 4.0 AMP HOUR battery runs out fast with blower and chain saw not enough cutting power, weed trimmer and blower good quality.
customer_reviews.author: P.d

product_meta.title: Greenworks 12-Inch 40V Cordless Chainsaw, 2.0 AH Battery and Charger Included 20262
product_meta.description: Style:2.0Ah Battery + ChargerGreen Works G-MAX 40V Lithium-Ion 12-inch Chainsaw features a robust 12-inch steel bar and chain, 3/8-inch chain pitch, automatic oiler and tool-less chain tensioning. Green Works G-MAX 2.0 AH Lithium-Ion Battery and Charger included. Compatible with G-MAX Batteries 29462 and 29472 only.
feature_bullets: High Performance G-MAX 40V Lithium-Ion Battery delivers fade-free power with no memory loss after charging
Robust 12-inch steel chain and bar with tool-less chain tensioning offers ease of use while delivering the highest cutting performance
3/8-inch chain pitch delivers the right amount of capabilities to get those limbs trimmed and cut with minimal kickback

Automatic oiler applies oil to bar and chain when needed to ensure durability and optimal use with a translucent oil tank for clear view of oil level.Wrap around handle for multiple cutting positions to provide ease of use when trimming at different angles
40V G-Max and 40V Lithium-Ion Batteries are not cross compatible; this tool is compatible with the G-Max 2.0 Ah battery (29462) and the G-Max 4.0 Ah battery (29472)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,674 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
